com.versant.event
Class ObjectChannelBuilder

java.lang.Object
  com.versant.event.ChannelBuilder
      com.versant.event.ObjectChannelBuilder
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class ObjectChannelBuilder
extends ChannelBuilder

Used to specify the properties of an object-based channel. An object-based channel can generate events for the modification and deletion of specific objects in the database.

The ObjectChannelBuilder automatically adds the event types OBJECT_DELETED and OBJECT_MODIFIED to the channel. If desired, these types can be removed from the channel using the removeEventType() or removeEventTypeRange() methods.

See Also:

Constructor Detail

ObjectChannelBuilder

public ObjectChannelBuilder()
Constructs an empty, default ObjectChannelBuilder. The default ObjectChannelBuilder contains an empty set of objects to monitor. Use the addObject() method to specify which instances will be monitored for events.

See Also:
ObjectChannelBuilder.addObject(java.lang.Object)

ObjectChannelBuilder

public ObjectChannelBuilder(java.lang.Object[] objects)
Constructs an ObjectChannelBuilder with the given set of persistent objects. This is equivalent to constructing an empty ObjectChannelBuilder and invoking the setObjects() method.

See Also:
ObjectChannelBuilder.setObjects(java.lang.Object[])
Method Detail

addObject

public void addObject(java.lang.Object object)
Adds a persistent object to this channel. By default, any update or delete operations on this object will generate events on this channel. The given object can be either a persistent Java object (when using Transparent JVI) or a Handle (when using Fundamental JVI). If the object is already associated with this channel, then the request is ignored.

getObjects

public java.lang.Object[] getObjects()
Returns the objects that are being monitored on this channel. Note that modifying this array will not change the objects associated with this channel. (That is, the array is a copy of the internal list of objects.)

removeObject

public void removeObject(java.lang.Object object)
Removes the association of the given object with this channel. If the object was not already associated with this channel, then the request is ignored.

setObjects

public void setObjects(java.lang.Object[] objects)
Sets the list of objects to be monitored on this channel. This method will overwrite any previously set objects.

getProperties

public java.util.Properties getProperties()
Returns a Property object. For an instance of this class the key/value pairs returned are 1. events(key)/Events defined for this channel (value). 2. objects(key)/Objects that this channel is monitoring (value).
